programme.title: Great Artists of the Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: This episode examines the features of late medieval culture in Italy that paved the way for the Renaissance.

programme.title: Great Artists of the Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: Around 1400, a European-wide style known as International Gothic flourished in Italy.

programme.title: Great Artists of the Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: This episode looks at the buildings of Filippo Brunelleschi and the famous bronze doors of Lorenzo Ghiberti.

programme.title: Great Artists of the Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: This episode traces Donatello's work until he moved to Padua in 1443.

programme.title: Great Artists of the Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: The first of two episodes on Masaccio examines his Pisa Altarpiece.

programme.title: Great Artists of the Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: This episode looks at Masaccio's principal frescoes for the Brancacci Chapel.

programme.title: Great Artists of the Italian Renaissance
programme.sub-title: Fra Angelico and Fra Filippo Lippi
programme.desc: Fra Angelico and Fra Filippo Lippi were the most important painters in Florence after the death of Masaccio.

programme.title: Great Artists of the Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: Paintings by three contrasting artists: Paolo Uccello, Andrea del Castagno, and Domenico Veneziano.

programme.title: The Italian Renaissance
programme.sub-title: The Study of the Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: Learn why the Italian Renaissance remains fundamental to Western culture.

programme.title: The Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: The Renaissance was the first self-conscious period of European history.

programme.title: The Italian Renaissance
programme.sub-title: Italy - The Cradle of the Renaissance
programme.desc: The Renaissance developed in part through memories of the Roman Empire.

programme.title: The Italian Renaissance
programme.sub-title: The Age of Dante Guelfs and Ghibellines
programme.desc: Learn how Dante defined the transition to the Renaissance.

programme.title: The Italian Renaissance
programme.sub-title: Petrarch and the Foundations of Humanism
programme.desc: Petrarch\'s desire to know himself recovered the genre of autobiography.

programme.title: The Italian Renaissance
programme.desc: For Italians, ancient Rome was a heritage to be mined for contemporary use.

programme.sub-title: Florence - The Creation of the Republic
programme.desc: Learn how Florence became the cradle of the Renaissance.

programme.desc: Examine the adaptation of classical learning into "Civic" Humanism.

programme.title: Forensic History: Crimes, Frauds, and Scandals
programme.desc: Start your journey through forensic history with the Jack the Ripper murders.

programme.title: Forensic History: Crimes, Frauds, and Scandals
programme.desc: Study the special forensic category known as lust murder with the 1947 murder-mutilation of the Black Dahlia.

programme.title: Forensic History: Crimes, Frauds, and Scandals
programme.desc: Go to Hollywood and look at how crime scene investigation and autopsy results solve mysteries.

programme.title: Forensic History: Crimes, Frauds, and Scandals
programme.desc: How can cutting-edge research and technology be applied to old cases and result in fresh conclusions?

programme.title: The Agency: A History of the CIA
programme.sub-title: Secrecy, Democracy, and the Birth of the CIA
programme.desc: Examine three key periods of U.S. intelligence before the birth of the CIA.

programme.title: The Agency: A History of the CIA
programme.sub-title: George Kennan and the Rise of Covert Ops
programme.desc: Learn how the CIA transformed from an intelligence agency to housing a premier covert-action unit.

programme.title: The Agency: A History of the CIA
programme.sub-title: The CIA, China, and the Korean War
programme.desc: Discover how the CIA failed to rein in the growing emphasis on covert operations.

programme.title: The Agency: A History of the CIA
programme.desc: Ponder who was most responsible for Mohammad Mosaddeq's fall from power.

programme.title: The Agency: A History of the CIA
programme.desc: Explore the CIA's role in the Guatemalan coup (the operation PB-SUCCESS).
